review: This item is way over billed.  Yes, it is only $35.  You basically get access to 2 services, Netflix and YouTube (and any other thing you can display via the browser), which provide absolutely horrible picture quality.  I can already get both Netflix and YouTube straight through my Tivo box.  Also, t'he Chromecast iOS app I installed on my iPad to set this up and use it could be one of the least robust apps I have ever seen.  It truly does nothing but tell you what version you are running and what devices are available.  So disappointing.  If you want something like this, go with AppleTV. It is a WAY better deal at $99, even if you don't buy Apple content (it has everything Chromecast has, plus a lot more...HBO Go, Hulu and many others.  I am no Apple fan, believe me, but this product is just not comparable, even for $35.  Pay the extra $65 and get AppleTV (Which also comes with a remote, unlike CC)
author: Levi45 "levi"

review: I like the idea and it was easy to set up and use on both my iPad and MacBook. I already have Netflix thru my TiVo. Don't watch much YouTube. The only thing we use it for is watching TV shows we have missed via a browser on my laptop.  Maybe someday they will expand the functionality.  That said, it does everything they say it does, just not a compelling gadget. with a low price, I can justify it for the 4 or 5 times a year I use it.  Still, an interesting concept that can have more content in the future. Hopefully.

review: I have had Chromecast for about a week and for the most part it was working great. Suddenly today I can't cast any google products on GOOGLE's own Chromecast. I will be returning the two I bought and saying good buy to purchasing google products in the future.
